TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 335
TEI.2.document_title: John L. Brickey to Moses Austin, 01-17-1819

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 335

div1.p: I promise to pay Moses Austin the sum of twenty seven Dollars and seventy five cents, in Cash on or before the third Monday of March next. January the 7th 1819—that is in case I get seventy four Bushels of corn from Samuel P. Brown on account of Mr Austin's order which he has given me for the same.
[Moses Austin's endorsement:] Received on this Note forty five bushels of Corn @ 37$ Cents
